newsitem.title: UK: Guardian Royal up after Laing support.
newsitem.headline: Guardian Royal up after Laing support.

text.p: Shares in Guardian Royal Exchange Plc rose in a mixed composite insurance sector on Friday, as Credit Lyonnais Laing repeated a "buy" rating on the stock and highlighted its discount to net asset value, dealers said.
Guardian Royal shares were up 4p at 288-1/2 by 1223 GMT in volume of 2.5 million shares, outpacing rivals such as Royal & Sun Alliance Plc and Commercial Union Plc.
Analyst David Hudson at Laing said Guardian Royal was more heavily geared to the equity market than rivals and was therefore in a position to benefit from recent stock market strength.
"With a net asset value that has gone through 330p, the discount has widened to a point where it is looking oversold," Hudson said.
